intro: Lappula lipskyi, commonly known as the Siberian salsify, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Asia, particularly Siberia and the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Camelotaceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are often dispersed by wind. Lappula lipskyi is adapted to grow in harsh, arid environments, showcasing its resilience to extreme temperatures and poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of alpine and tundra ecosystems.
